intro: Hackelia hispida var. disjuncta, commonly known as the Disjunct Hackelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to full sun. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Scrophulariaceae family.
